Module roborallyGUI
Package game.gameObjects.bot

Class QLearning

java.lang.Object
game.gameObjects.bot.QLearning
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
public class QLearning
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable
QLearning: This class uses Q-learning (value-based learning algorithm) to study the map given and provide the best path from a given starting point to a given target.

  • Constructor Details

    • QLearning

      public QLearning​(FieldObject[][] fullMap, int startingState, int checkpoint, java.lang.String mapType)

  • Method Details

    • fillRewardsMatrix

      private void fillRewardsMatrix()
      fillRewardsMatrix(): goes through all possible states and adds a value to the rewards matrix accordingly. Walls, Lasers and Pits get a penalty (-10), checkpoints get a reward (100) and other field types get 0. initializeQ() is automatically initiated after the matrix is filled.

    • moveLeft

      public void moveLeft​(int k, int i, int j, java.lang.String currentType)
      moveLeft(): checks if moving left from current state is possible and if the target state is a checkpoint.
      Parameters:
      k - : current state
      i - : row number
      j - : column number
      currentType - : current state's type

    • moveRight

      public void moveRight​(int k, int i, int j, java.lang.String currentType)
      moveRight(): checks if moving right from current state is possible and if the target state is a checkpoint.
      Parameters:
      k - : current state
      i - : row number
      j - : column number
      currentType - : current state's type

    • moveUp

      public void moveUp​(int k, int i, int j, java.lang.String currentType)
      moveUp(): checks if moving up from current state is possible and if the target state is a checkpoint.
      Parameters:
      k - : current state
      i - : row number
      j - : column number
      currentType - : current state's type

    • moveDown

      public void moveDown​(int k, int i, int j, java.lang.String currentType)
      moveDown(): checks if moving down from current state is possible and if the target state is a checkpoint.
      Parameters:
      k - : current state
      i - : row number
      j - : column number
      currentType - : current state's type

    • initializeQ

      private void initializeQ()
      initializeQ(): initializes the Q-Matrix by filling it up with the values of the rewards matrix. calculateQ() is then called automatically.

    • calculateQ

      private void calculateQ()
      calculateQ(): trains for 1000 cycles to find the best path to tne checkpoint. The values of the Q-Matrix are updated accordingly.

    • isPit

      private boolean isPit​(int crtState)

    • isFinalState

      private boolean isFinalState​(int state)
      isFinalState(): checks if a state is a checkpoint
      Parameters:
      state - : state nnumber
      Returns:
      true if state is checkpoint otherwise false

    • possibleMovesFromState

      private int[] possibleMovesFromState​(int state)
      possibleMovesFromState():
      Parameters:
      state - : state number for whom the reachable states should be calculated
      Returns:
      an array containing all reachable states from a given state

    • maxQ

      private double maxQ​(int nextState)
      maxQ(): finds the highest Q-Value of all possible moves from given state
      Parameters:
      nextState - : state to be visited
      Returns:
      maximum Q-Value of given state

    • findBestPath

      public java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.Integer> findBestPath​(int i)
      findBestPath(): finds best Path from given state
      Parameters:
      i - : starting state
      Returns:
      list containing best path from given starting point to the checkpoint.

    • getBestMove

      private int getBestMove​(int state)
      getBestMove(): returns the number of the state that has the highest Q-Value.
      Parameters:
      state - : current state
      Returns:
      best move from state

    • printR

      private void printR()
      printR(): prints the rewards matrix. Originally used for testing purposes.

    • printQ

      private void printQ()
      printQ(): prints the Q-matrix. Originally used for testing purposes.

    • printPath

      public void printPath()
      printPath(): prints the best path. Originally used for testing purposes.

    • blueBeltMovementBot

      public javafx.util.Pair<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Integer> blueBeltMovementBot​(int currentPosition, int currentOrientation)
      blueBeltMovementBot(): calculates the Position and Orientation of the Bot, when moving onto a BlueBelt
      Parameters:
      currentPosition - the Position, the Bot moves to
      currentOrientation - Orientation of the Bot
      Returns:
      a Pair (newPosition, newOrientation)

    • checkPit

      public boolean checkPit​(int nextX, int nextY)
      checks if there is a pit at the next player position
      Parameters:
      nextX - xPosition of the field the player wants to go
      nextY - yPosition of the field the player wants to go
      Returns:
      true, if there is a pit on that position

    • calculateDirection

      public int calculateDirection​(double directionDeg)
      calculateDirection():
      Parameters:
      directionDeg - the orientation of a FieldObject, -90,0,90,180
      Returns:
      the direction as an int 1,2,3,4
